docs.lead_paragraph: Young men who use laptops may be well advised to keep them off their laps if they want to have children to e-mail someday, a new study suggests. An hour of using a laptop in that position generated enough heat to impair the body's ability to produce healthy sperm.
docs.abstract: Dr Yefim Sheynkin, State University of New York at Stony Brook researcher, leads study published in European Medical journal Human Reproduction that suggests men using laptop computers on their laps can negatively impact sperm production; heat from laptop and body position cause temperature of groin to rise above normal levels, which can cause reproductive problems; drawing (S)
docs.snippet: Young men who use laptops may be well advised to keep them off their laps if they want to have children to e-mail someday, a new study suggests.

keywords.name: organizations
keywords.value: STATE UNIVERSITY OF NEW YORK AT STONY BROOK
